texture.layers¶

Instances of keras.engine.topology.Layer with learnable parameters.

Encoding¶

class texture.layers.Encoding(K, dropout=None, l2_normalize=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Residual encoding layer with learnable codebook and scaling factors.

Encodes an collection of NxD features into set of KxD vectors. Unlike PyTorch implementation, D is inferred automatically from input_shape.

Allowed `input_shape`s are (batches, N, D) or (batches, H, W, D).

Parameters:
  • K (int) – Number of codewords to learn
  • dropout (float, optional) –
    Dropout rate between [0.0,1.0), or None, default=`None`.
    Currently applied to scale factors, which is equivalent to zeroing out dropout fraction of the aggregated codewords.
  • l2_normalize (bool, optional) – Whether to normalize output vectors, default=`True`.
  • TODO –
    • make sure dropout only applied during training

KernelPooling¶

class texture.layers.KernelPooling(p=3, d_i=4096, seed=0, gamma=0.0001, X_train=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Kernel Pooling layer with learnable composition weights. Takes convolution output volume as input, outputs a Taylor series kernel of order p. By default the weights are initialized to approximate the Gaussian RBF kernel. See the paper for more detailed exposition. Kernel vectors are average pooled over all spatial locations (h_i, w_j).

output_shape=(batches,1+C+Sum(d_2,…,d_p)), for input_shape=(batches,H,W,C). This implementation follows the paper in assuming that d_i=d_bar for all i>=2, so d=1+C+(p-1)*d_i.

Parameters:
  • p (int, optional) – Order of the polynomial approximation, default=3
  • d_i (int, optional) – Dimensionality of output features of each order {2,…,p}, default=4096.
  • seed (int, optional) – Random seed for generating sketch matrices. If given, will use range(seed, seed+p) for h, and range(seed+p, seed+2p) for s.
  • gamma (float, optional) – RBF kernel approximation parameter, default=1e-4.
  • X_train (array, optional) – Training set of features from which to estimate gamma s.t. kernel closely approximates RBF. If provided, will use reciprocal of mean inner product values. Otherwise, default used.

BilinearModel¶

class texture.layers.BilinearModel[source]¶

Weighted bilinear model of two inputs. Useful for learning a model of linear interactions between seperate feature types (e.g., texture X spatial) or scales (e.g., dense X dilated), etc.
